value.title: The Morning After: AI-generated video plays out fake Wimbledon matchups
value.excerpt: This morning we're looking back at some of the week's biggest stories, while the Engadget Podcast discusses the Surface Duo and Galaxy Watch 3.

value.title: Elon Musk Says Tesla Developing Neural Network Training Computer for Full Self-Driving
value.excerpt: With a complete overhaul of the Tesla autopilot software, full self-driving capabilities will be possible as the AI will be able to interpret traffic signals, turns and stops.

value.title: How The US Department Of Health & Human Services (HHS) Is Innovating With AI: An Interview With Oki Mek
value.excerpt: Oki Mek, Senior Advisor to HHS CIO shares how HHS is adopting and implementing AI, how adoption of new technologies in the public sectors differs from the private sector, and challenges to AI adoption.

value.title: White House Aims To Boost Funding For AI And Quantum Tech By 30% In 2021
value.excerpt: By committing to invest $2.2 billion next year, the Trump administration says it is on track to honor a pledge to roughly double non-defense R&D spending on the two key technologies between 2020 and 2022.

value.title: Clearview AI landed a new facial recognition contract with ICE

value.title: How Facebook’s Yann LeCun is charting a path to human-level intelligence
value.excerpt: Facebook's chief AI scientist Yann LeCun told TNW about the latest work at FAIR, the social network's research lab.

value.title: Google researchers use quantum computing to help improve image classification
value.excerpt: In a new tutorial, Google researchers demonstrate how quantum computing techniques can improve accuracy in tasks like image classification.

value.title: Driving digital transformation with continuous automation and AI-assistance
value.excerpt: Even before the pandemic swept the globe, organizations were already deeply invested in digital transformation to improve operational efficiencies and enhance user and customer experiences. value.title: Quantum Computing: What Does It Mean For AI (Artificial Intelligence)?
value.excerpt: So then what is quantum computing? Well, it is similar to traditional computing, which relies on bits—that is, the 0’s and 1’s to encode information. But quantum computing as its own version of this: the quantum bit or qubit.

value.title: Horrific AI surveillance experiment uses convicted felons as human guinea pigs

value.title: There is a crisis of face recognition and policing in the US
value.excerpt: When news broke that a mistaken match from a face recognition system had led Detroit police to arrest Robert Williams for a crime he didn’t commit, it was late June, and the country was already in upheaval over the death of George Floyd a month earlier.

value.title: Chip startup Blaize debuts AI modules for machine learning at the edge

value.title: Google open-sources LIT, a toolset for evaluating natural language models
value.excerpt: Google-affiliated researchers developed an open source framework -- Language Interpretability Tool (LIT) designed to explore and audit language models.

value.title: AI, analytics, and NLP are valuable, despite lack of obvious financial return
value.excerpt: Instead of focusing on return to business, consider how technologies can give your business a competitive advantage.

value.title: Problematic study on Indiana parolees seeks to predict recidivism with AI
value.excerpt: A four-year effort to monitor parolees in Indiana with bracelets and use AI algorithms to predict their behavior raises red flags.

value.title: Urban Autonomy: The Next Stage Of Self-Driving
value.excerpt: Driving on city streets versus the highway presents an exponentially more complicated situation stemming from the visual perception problem.

value.title: Taking A Stand In Uncertain Times With AI
value.excerpt: This moment in time has uncovered just how crucial AI solutions can be for the future of healthcare. Rapid changes have made it difficult to manage the pandemic’s spread and determine what the industry will look like after coming through the other side.

value.title: How Reuters analysed Rite Aid's use of facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: Reuters analysed Rite Aid stores in America's two biggest cities to determine which received facial recognition technology and which did not. The news agency gathered this data through one or more visits by Reuters journalists to all 75 Rite Aid locations in Manhattan and the central Los Angeles metro area from October 2019 through July 2020.

value.title: Indonesia sets sights on artificial intelligence in new national strategy
value.excerpt: The government has introduced a national strategy for developing artificial intelligence, but experts are calling for assurances that progress in this high-tech field is safe and beneficial for all.

value.title: Melting ‘frozen memories,’ AI helps Japanese recall war days

value.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator developer Q&A addresses top community questions and concerns

value.title: Amazon EC2 Inf1 instances featuring AWS Inferentia chips now available in five new Regions and with improved performance
value.excerpt: Following strong customer demand, AWS has expanded the availability of Amazon EC2 Inf1 instances to five new Regions: US East (Ohio), Asia Pacific (Sydney, Tokyo), and Europe (Frankfurt, Ireland). value.title: Baidu’s Revenue Shrinks Under Pressure from ByteDance in Ads
value.excerpt: Baidu Inc.’s quarterly revenue shrank 1% and its projections suggest sales could slide again, as rivals like ByteDance Ltd. continue to chip away at its core advertising business.

value.title: Healthcare provider and payer execs point to AI, robotics as next industry disruptors: report
value.excerpt: Nearly half of healthcare provider and payer executives (45 percent) believe that rapid advancements in new tech and innovations will disrupt the healthcare industry, according to an Aug. 11 Accenture report.

value.title: Artificial intelligence warning: AI will know us better than we know ourselves
value.excerpt: ARTIFICIAL Intelligence (AI) is a totalitarian's dream and will have the potential to know you better than you know yourself, a researcher has claimed.

value.title: Amazon launches Braket quantum computing service in general availability
value.excerpt: Amazon today launched its fully managed quantum computing service -- Braket -- in general availability following a preview.
